results.title: The Four Minute Mile
results.brief_description: An on-the-spot account of Roger Bannister’s record-breaking mile, run on the Oxford University Athletic Ground. Shows the brilliant performance of Chataway and Brasher as pace-makers. The film concludes with a brief camera interview with Bannister

results.title: The Fountain of Jabalia
results.creator_credit: Jose Quisand and United Nations Films
results.brief_description: Depicts the life of Palesinian Arab refugees at Jabalia Camp, in the Gaza Strip. The film shows the work of the vocational training schools which are producing skilled craftsmen whose services are in keen demand. It also illistrates how the United Nations is setting up families in their own farms so that they can become self supporting.

results.title: The Forgiving Lord
results.creator_credit: Franco Zeffirelli, Vincenzo Labella and Don Bosco Multimedia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Jesus of Nazareth”.
The continuing story of the life of Jesus Christ from: Jesus cures the paralytic man; Jesus is welcomed by Matthew and tells the parable of the prodigal son; Peter and Matthew are reconciled; Matthew and Peter leave everything and follow Jesus.

results.title: The Forerunner
results.creator_credit: John Heyer and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: Professor C.H. Munro introduces Australia’s water problem - the periodic cycles of flood and drought and the first major step in its solution, the Snowy Mountains scheme. The first part shows floods in town and country areas and rescue teams at work; the second, drought and a family forced to abandon their property; finally, the aims of the Snowy Mountains Scheme and some of the work in progress. Little commentary is used. Ballads and natural sound accompany evocative visuals.
results.description: Professor C.H. Munro introduces Australia’s water problem - the periodic cycles of flood and drought and the first major step in its solution, the Snowy Mountains scheme. The first part shows floods in town and country areas and rescue teams at work; the second, drought and a family forced to abandon their property; finally, the aims of the Snowy Mountains Scheme and some of the work in progress. Little commentary is used. Ballads and natural sound accompany evocative visuals.

results.title: The Force of gravity [B&W]
results.creator_credit: Lothar Wolff and National Academy of Sciences (U.S.)
results.brief_description: Our attempt to understand gravitation, especially in its relation to cosmology and geophysics; the views of the Egyptians and the Greeks, the later work of Copernicus, Kepler, Galileo and Newton and modern methods of studying and measuring gravity in different parts of the earth’s surface, with an explanation of the effect of the moon’s gravitational pull on the earth.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lothar Wolff and National Academy of Sciences (U.S.)

results.title: The Foolish frog
results.creator_credit: Gene Deitch, William Bernal and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: An animated adaptation of a Pete Seeger Folk-song about a farmer who witnesses a bullfrog falling into the mud and makes up a catchy song about it. Soon the whole town is singing it. When the frog hears the popular song about himself he explodes with pride, imparting a valuable lesson to all. Buoyant illustrations seem to dance along the screen.

results.title: The Foolish brother
results.creator_credit: Andrew Grieve, Barry Levinson and Hemisphere Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Storybook International”.
Two brothers suddenly obtain a sack of gold coins while Abdul, the foolish brother is out chopping trees. After leaving their village the brothers are attacked by brigands and it is Abdul’s foolishness which saves the day. A Turkish tale. Narrated by Claire Nielson.
